title: Olaf Changes on PBE
body: So Olaf is getting a buff on his ult that will increase his movespeed by 50/60/70% for 1 second when his ult is activated when running at enemies. I've seen a lot of people complain about how short the duration is. IMO you aren't looking at the big picture. If you combine this MS bonus with {{item:3800}} you are able to chase down opponents for a VERY long time, so i ont feel the need for the MS bonus on his ult to be any longer than it now is.

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=TheInfamousGreed,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=g59yzNiv,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-05-04T20:57:57.775+0000)
>
> So Olaf is getting a buff on his ult that will increase his movespeed by 50/60/70% for 1 second when his ult is activated when running at enemies. I've seen a lot of people complain about how short the duration is. IMO you aren't looking at the big picture. If you combine this MS bonus with {{item:3800}} you are able to chase down opponents for a VERY long time, so i ont feel the need for the MS bonus on his ult to be any longer than it now is.

Needing an item to actually make use of the bonus from the ult doesnt make it good.

Im waiting until i get a chance to use it, but I believe that it is just too short.  1 second is still not enough time to overcome the majority of gap-openers that champions have.

> [{quoted}](name=Durzaka,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=g59yzNiv,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-05-05T00:52:30.615+0000)
>
> Needing an item to actually make use of the bonus from the ult doesnt make it good.
> 
> Im waiting until i get a chance to use it, but I believe that it is just too short.  1 second is still not enough time to overcome the majority of gap-openers that champions have.

You might be right, but keep in mind that as of this post the MS buff doesn't decay. A tanked out, steroided viking you can't push back is running at you with even more speed now than ever. I honestly hope that he doesn't need to cling to {{item:3800}} to be effective though, because then its just pigeon-holing him to an item and restraining his power curve. An ability shouldn't need an item to be good, and vice versa.

Let's just say 50% movement speed puts him at 500 ms (simplicity sake). That is 500 units traveled per second.

Lucian's E is 425
Graves' E is 425
Caitlyn's E is 400
Corki's W is 800
Tristana's W is 900.

We are talking about him not even being able to catch someone with the shortest gap openers. He might get in range to land an E, then he is fucked again.

And then there are those who still laughably kite him all day (Kalista anyone?).

With regular boots, level 6 puts him at 511 movespeed. Tier 2 boots put him at 526. Adding alacrity gives an additional 15 speed.
Level 11 puts him at 530 movespeed. Tier 2 boots at 11 gives him 546 movespeed. Alacrity will net him 16 movespeed.
Level 16 would give him 548 movespeed. Tier 2 boots give 566 movespeed. Alacrity will net 17 movespeed.

These calculations assume no other movement abilities, items, or runes/masteries.

Yes, for one second.

You forget that gap openers tend to happen instantly, especially the shorter ones.

Meaning not only do they get the distance of the gap opener, but they also get another half second of their own movement speed (IE Lucian's Dash only takes like 1/4 of a second or so, and his base movement speed is 335. So even without boots, he moves another 250ish units before olafs bonus speed ends (putting him 650 units from where he started in the time Olaf travels his 566).

Unless the movement boost lasts a long time, movement speed is a bad form of mobility in the game right now.
I am neither refuting or supporting your claim. I am only providing data.

At least they give some kind of buff, is better than nothing...

You need to take in account that he advance a lot in the 1 second because nothing can't stop it, so {{item:3800}} can help him  to ends the job if he don't reach anyone.

_"Needing an item to actually make use of the bonus from the ult doesnt make it good."_

His ult never in the life have been "created" to give him MS, now that this happen is a huuuge buff on him. both his 1 second MS steroid and RG can put him in a good spot to engage, now they need to fix the passive defenses and active part AD problem to put his ult in a healthy state.

I personally prefer they remove the passive bonus, but add a damage reduction when the ult is active:

>  10 / 15 / 20% + (0.5% by every 1% missing of health) damage reduction .

This turn him into a true Behemoth when Ragnarok is ON.

I did take into account, if you see my reply below.  He still is only going to have around 500 MS before level 16. And 500 ms = 500 units moved per second. Roughly equal to most short ranged gap openers.
So {{item:3800}} need to be a item on him, help him to reach people during Ragnarok.
Lol I am just happy about the fact that he is getting a buff
I would much rather he get 20% movespeed when moving towards his axe

You're not taking Olaf's Undertow (Q) into account. Yeah they can dash away, but if you land that at any point, they'll still be slowed afterwards. They won't have anything to stop him since he can't be cc'ed, so they have no choice but to burst him down or hope to run away, unless they manage to get over a wall. As for kalista, I don't have an answer for you, she can pretty much kite anyone to death if played right :P
NOOOO!!!!! people will probably start playing him more
